content:
Receiving an API webhook indicator

To receive your API webhook indicators, you'll need to set up a webhook endpoint. This is essentially an IP address or URL that is capable of receiving HTTP requests from our system.

For example, you could configure an endpoint like:
http://my-trading-bot/marketraker-webhooks
Your server should also be prepared to accept incoming POST requests containing data. This endpoint will act as a listener for incoming webhook notifications, allowing you to process the data and integrate it with your application or trading bot in real time.

  1. Items needed for receiving indicators:
    • A registered and active webhook.
    • A server capable of receiving POST requests containing Data.
    • At least 10 000 raker tokens.
  2. Examples: Below are example of how to receive an indicator: 
    1. from fastapi import Request, HTTPException

      async def webhook_endpoint(request: Request):
          try:

           payload:dict = await request.json()
           return payload

          except Exception as e:
           print(f'Error processing webhook: {e}')
           raise HTTPException(status_code=500, detail='Internal server error')
    2. Look at our Indicator Integration GitHub example.
